intro: Stisseria lepida, commonly known as the slender stisseria, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in umbel-like clusters. Native to southern Africa, this plant thrives in moist, well-drained soils and partial shade. Its aromatic foliage and delicate blossoms make it a desirable ornamental plant. However, it is important to note that it may be considered invasive in certain regions outside its native habitat.
